meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound.
meanings.sent1: The rusty gate was creeshing loudly in the wind.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the old car creeshing down the gravel road.
meanings.sent3: The branches creeshing against the window made the cat jump.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the machine were creeshing like a rusty old bicycle.
meanings.sent5: The chalk on the blackboard creeshing made everyone cringe.

meanings.definition: The act of grinding or scraping together with a harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The creeshing of the metal against metal was deafening.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the creeshing of the knife against the cutting board.
meanings.sent3: The creeshing of the brakes on the bike sounded like a symphony.
meanings.sent4: The creeshing of the gears in the clock was a constant reminder of time passing.
meanings.sent5: The creeshing of the chalk on the sidewalk echoed through the empty street.
